Motivation
Motivation

Consider the dynamical system describing the variable x,
Consider the dynamical system describing the variable x,

dx/dt = N(x) + F
dx/dt = N(x) + F

(N is a nonlinear operator and F is external forcing)
(N is a nonlinear operator and F is external forcing)

This can always be rewritten as
This can always be rewritten as

dx/dt = slow nonlinearity + fast nonlinearity
dx/dt = slow nonlinearity + fast nonlinearity

If: ▪ we are only interested in the slowly evolving portion of x ▪ and there is a big difference between “fast” and “slow”

this may be usefully approximated as

Branstator 1995

Candidates for “boundary forcing” to extratropical troposphere
Candidates for “boundary forcing” to
extratropical troposphere

• Surface anomalies
• Surface anomalies

– SST – Soil moisture anomalies (warm season) – Sea ice/snow cover anomalies (seasonal)
– SST
– Soil moisture anomalies (warm season)
– Sea ice/snow cover anomalies (seasonal)

• Tropical heating
• Tropical heating

– Driven by SST (e.g., ENSO) – Atmospheric phenomena (e.g., MJO)
– Driven by SST (e.g., ENSO)
– Atmospheric phenomena (e.g., MJO)

• Stratospheric anomalies
• Stratospheric anomalies

These act all at the same time and not independently.
These act all at the same time and not independently.

This may be easier, but is not pain-free.

Linear inverse model (LIM)
Linear inverse model (LIM)

x(t) = 86-component vector whose components are the time-varying coefficients of the leading slp, yT (250 and 750 hPa), H, and yS (30 hPa) PCs of 7-day running means.

effectively linear, why does the LIM
outperform the GCM at Week 3?

Sura, Newman, Sardeshmukh, and Penland 2004

Can we expect to forecast Weeks 3 and 4?
Can we expect to forecast Weeks 3 and 4?

Yes, but:
Yes, but:

• Empirical models (LIM + others in Tropics)
• Empirical models (LIM + others in Tropics)

appear to still have better forecast skill than GCM But there are may be areas of nonoverlapping skill (particularly for skewed distributions), and/or we may use more skillful tropical LIM forecasts to nudge GCM.
appear to still have better forecast skill than GCM
But there are may be areas of nonoverlapping skill (particularly for
skewed distributions), and/or we may use more skillful tropical LIM
forecasts to nudge GCM.

• Extratropical forecast skill is modest on average
• Extratropical forecast skill is modest on average

But there are cases when the skill is relatively high. These cases can to some extent be identified a priori and provide forecasts of opportunity.
But there are cases when the skill is relatively high. These cases can to
some extent be identified a priori and provide forecasts of opportunity.

• As GCM skill surpasses LIM, predictability estimates from LIM may remain useful But in the mean time, Week 3 and Week 4 forecasts may be made now.
• As GCM skill surpasses LIM, predictability • A s

s u r p a s s e s

p r e d i c t a b i l i t y
estimates from LIM may remain useful
But in the mean time, Week 3 and Week 4 forecasts may be made now.
